column4: hello, having issues mounting my windoze partition... everything else mounts fine
I wasn't telling you to symlink anything... and it's a bad idea for what you want to do.
wipe the drive... boot with windows 98, fdisk /mbr, fdisk, wipe all your partitions, create a primary partition of 15GB, extended partition of 25GB... don't make any new partitions in the extended...

install Windows XP first - on NTFS, do your updates, and install Partition Magic.  Leave C: at 15GB or resize to 10GB, your choice.  create 10-50mb ext3 partition at the beginning of the extended drive, then /(root) 2gb, /usr 4gb, /tmp 1gb, /var 200mb, remaining(/home), 1-2gb swap, 10GB FAT32  (don't label anything, just make them all ext3 with Partition Magic... after it's done, THEN install Ubuntu, and all your
the 10-50mb was for /boot, in case you were wondering...
does that work in your fstab?
i had the wrong hda# listed, fixed it and now all is well
congrats... glad you got it fixed...
